questions.question: What differentiates this from existing solutions (asciiquarium, freefish)?
questions.answer: Full simulation mechanics - fish need care, can get sick, breed, and die. Not just a screensaver.

questions.question: Is this purely visual/meditative, or does it have simulation/gameplay elements?
questions.answer: Full simulation with gameplay elements - actual virtual pet mechanics

questions.question: ASCII art, Unicode characters, or a mix? What level of detail?
questions.answer: Simple ASCII only - `><>` style, 1-3 characters per fish

questions.question: Color support expectations? (16 colors, 256, true color, or monochrome)
questions.answer: Basic 16 terminal colors for wide compatibility

questions.question: What lives in the aquarium? (fish species, plants, snails, shrimp, decorations?)
questions.answer: Fish only for Tier 1. Multiple species with mechanical variety.

questions.question: Do entities have behaviors/AI? (schooling, hiding, feeding patterns)
questions.answer: Simple movement only - no complex behaviors in Tier 1

questions.question: Is there a care/maintenance aspect? (feeding, cleaning, water quality)
questions.answer: Feeding only for Tier 1. No water quality or cleaning mechanics.

questions.question: Persistence - does the aquarium state save between sessions?
questions.answer: Yes - state saves. Time pauses when app closes, resumes when reopened.

questions.question: What user interactions are supported? (view only, feed, tap glass, add fish?)
questions.answer: Feed (global), add fish (sandbox), remove fish, view stats, adjust speed

questions.question: Target platform(s)? (macOS, Linux, Windows, cross-platform?)
questions.answer: macOS primary, Linux secondary, Windows nice-to-have

questions.question: Preferred implementation language?
questions.answer: Rust with ratatui

questions.question: Minimum terminal size requirements?
questions.answer: 80x24 minimum

questions.question: Time model: Real-time (1 min = 1 min), accelerated (1 min = 1 hour), or configurable?
questions.answer: Configurable - user can choose simulation speed

questions.question: Does the simulation run when the terminal is closed? (background daemon vs pause)
questions.answer: Pause - time stops when app closes, resumes when reopened

questions.question: What parameters should each fish track? (hunger, health, stress, age, happiness?)
questions.answer: Tier 1 (Light): Just Hunger + Health per fish. Keep it simple to start.

questions.question: Should the tank have ecosystem mechanics? (water quality, ammonia, pH, temperature?)
questions.answer: No - excluded from Tier 1. May add in future expansion.

questions.question: Full lifecycle: Do fish breed, grow from fry, age, and die of old age?
questions.answer: Super simple: breeding produces instant adults, no growth stages, natural death at lifespan end

questions.question: Disease mechanics: Can fish get sick? How is it treated? Is it contagious?
questions.answer: No illness mechanics in Tier 1. Death is starvation-only.

questions.question: Economy: Is there currency? Do you buy fish/equipment? Earn from breeding?
questions.answer: No economy - pure sandbox mode. Spawn any species freely.

questions.question: Goals: Sandbox mode, achievements, or structured progression?
questions.answer: Pure sandbox - no achievements, no goals, just simulation

questions.question: Individual personalities: Do fish have unique traits (shy, aggressive, greedy)?
questions.answer: No individual personalities in Tier 1 - species-level differences only

questions.question: Species differences: Different care needs, lifespans, breeding patterns per species?
questions.answer: Yes - mechanical variety. Each species has unique hunger rate, health, lifespan.

questions.question: Species mechanical differences: Should species differ in hunger rates, lifespans, base health, or just visual appearance?
questions.answer: Mechanical variety - each species has unique hunger rate, health stats, and lifespan

questions.question: ASCII art complexity: Simple single-char fish (><>) or multi-character sprites with detail?
questions.answer: Simple ASCII - 1-3 characters per fish (`><>`, `<><`, `><>>`)

questions.question: Breeding trigger: Automatic when conditions met (health + food), or player-initiated?
questions.answer: Automatic when conditions met - no player action required

questions.question: Species compatibility: Same species only, or allow cross-breeding?
questions.answer: Same species only - keeps it simple and realistic

questions.question: Baby fish: Instant adult, or visual fry stage that grows over time?
questions.answer: Instant adults - no growth stages

questions.question: Death triggers: Just starvation, or also random illness events?
questions.answer: Starvation only - hunger maxes out causes health to drain, death at 0 health

questions.question: Illness treatment: Always fatal, or can player cure sick fish?
questions.answer: N/A - no illness mechanics in Tier 1

questions.question: Visual indicators: How should sick/dying/dead fish look different?
questions.answer: No visual death stages - dead fish simply disappear. Hungry fish shown in yellow, critical in red.

questions.question: Feeding: Global scatter (all fish) or targeted feeding (specific fish)?
questions.answer: Global scatter - press key, all hungry fish eat

questions.question: Adding fish: Currency/shop system, or sandbox 'spawn fish' command?
questions.answer: Pure sandbox - spawn any species freely, no currency

questions.question: Other actions: Anything beyond feed + add fish? (remove fish, rename, select?)
questions.answer: Remove fish, select to view stats, adjust simulation speed

questions.question: Input model: Real-time keyboard commands, menu-based, or command-line style?
questions.answer: Real-time keyboard commands (ratatui event handling)

questions.question: Info display: What stats/info shown on screen? (individual fish, tank overview, both?)
questions.answer: Both - tank overview in header, selected fish stats in footer

questions.question: Fish selection: Can player select/highlight individual fish to see their stats?
questions.answer: Yes - tab or arrow keys to cycle through fish, show stats in footer
